LanguageData.XMonsters_StoneSpeed.label: stone speed
LanguageData.XMonsters_SlugSpeed.label: slug speed
LanguageData.XMonsters_HareSpeed.label: hare speed
LanguageData.XMonsters_HareSpeed.description:
<color=#a3a3cc>Dr. Madness's audio recording converted to text.</color>
This is the gene that I was the first to help research, along with other colleagues, in one of the <color=#660005>Madnessworlds</color>. This gene grants increased movement speed, but that's not what makes it unique. It's that it doesn't affect the host's metabolism in any way, and it can be implanted into anyone without any problems. Well... assuming, of course, that the recipient doesn't have any other genes that enhance movement speed. Some other researchers, as I found out, noted that this gene is very often found in some <color=#66c6cc>Xenohumans</color> from <color=#660005>Madnessworlds</color>, or as the inhabitants of these worlds call them, <color=#990007>Xenomonsters</color>.
